intro: Ayapana jaramillii, commonly known as the Jaramillo's ayapana, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly rough texture. Ayapana jaramillii is often found in moist, rocky soils at higher elevations.
